p:
We read with attention the review of Zimmerman and Curtis
1 on Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) among children and take the opportunity of this letter to share additional information. Infection with severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 has mostly been reported in adults, though a recent publication described 9 infants <1-year-old with COVID-19.
2 Among infant data are very few, though comparisons with infections due to other coronavirus strains will be helpful. The Pneumo-Study
3 on the etiologic agents of pneumonia in children <5-year-old conducted by the Merieux Foundation Global Approach to Biological Research, Infectious diseases and Epidemics in Low-income countries (GABRIEL) network provides opportunities for comparisons.
